text: Welcome to Solving with AWS Solutions
where we explore ready to deploy solutions
built by AWS. I'm Heather,
and today Jason and I are exploring our
QnABot on AWS solution.
This solution is an open source multi-channel,
multi-language conversational AI chatbot built
with Amazon Lex that responds to users' questions,
answers, and feedback.
If your team needs an easy to deploy,
fully managed chatbot, capable
of answering high customer inquiry volumes or voice
and text, that's also cost effective,
you'll want to learn more about this solution.
QnABot on AWS users range from businesses
with high call center traffic to universities
and government agencies looking for a way
to serve their customers by answering questions
that are typically handled by humans.
Time savings for users can be significant when they don't
have to wait for the next available agent
or when the agent has access to relevant information
faster. Deploying QnABot
has been shown to significantly reduce calls
handled by call center agents
and still provides users with a faster
and high-quality experience.
Imagine being able to provide an interactive way
for your customers to engage with your business,
ask questions, and receive relevant
answers in an automated way.
Some good examples are engaging users
with authentic conversational dialogue
and serving up relevant content.
You can configure QnABot
to use generative AI for clarifying questions,
summarizing text, and improving
natural language flow of a conversation.
With the support of Amazon Kendra, your agents
and customers can search documents, databases,
or websites for relevant answers.
QnABot also supports what's known as "Retrieval
Augmented Generation," a specific method to use your own data
to answer questions more accurately,
helping customers search
for the specific, up-to-date content you want them to have.
In one of our recent case studies,
the Kentucky Transportation Cabinet deployed
QnABot on AWS with Amazon Connect in order to assist
with call center operations.
The project included a six week contact center modernization
program, but once implemented resulted in 900,000 chatbot
interactions in the first month with only 1000
of these interactions needing
to be passed to a representative.
